free.jin
Class StandardLoginDialog

java.lang.Object
  free.jin.StandardLoginDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
LoginDialog
public abstract class StandardLoginDialog
extends java.lang.Object
implements LoginDialog

A partial, basic implementation of a LoginDialog.

Method Detail

getProperty

protected java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                       java.lang.String defaultValue)
Returns the property with the specified name. If the hint user is not null, its property with the specified name is returned, otherwise, if not null, the server's property, otherwise, the specified default value.

show

public void show(java.awt.Component parent)
Shows the user the login dialog and waits for the user to either ok or cancel.

Specified by:
show in interface LoginDialog
Parameters:
parent - A component over which to open the dialog. This component should usually be used for 2 purposes - determining the location of the dialog on the screen and obtaining the Frame necessary to open a modal dialog.

addComponents

protected void addComponents(javax.swing.JDialog dialog,
                             javax.swing.JTextField usernameField,
                             javax.swing.JPasswordField passwordField,
                             javax.swing.JComboBox hostnameBox,
                             javax.swing.JTextField portField,
                             javax.swing.JCheckBox savePWCheckBox)
Adds all the components to the dialog, in the appropriate layout.

createConnectAsGuestButton

protected javax.swing.JButton createConnectAsGuestButton()
Creates and returns the "connect as guest" button. Should return null if there is no such option on the server. The default implementation returns a simple JButton with the label "Connect as guest".

connectAsGuestActionPerformed

protected void connectAsGuestActionPerformed()
This method is called when the "connect as guest" button is pressed or an equivalent action is taken by the user. The default implementation sets the username field to "guest", clears the password field, creates a guest User and calls proceed().

createRegisterButton

protected javax.swing.JButton createRegisterButton()
Creates and returns a new "register" button. This button should take the user to the registration page. This method may not return null. The current implementation returns a simple JButton with the label "Register".

registerActionPerformed

protected abstract void registerActionPerformed()
This method is called when the "register" button is pressed or an equivalent action is taken by the user.

createGuestsPanel

public java.awt.Component createGuestsPanel(javax.swing.JDialog parentDialog)
Creates the "Guests" panel, the panel with options for guests.

Parameters:
parentDialog - The dialog to which the panel will be added.

createAdvancedOptionsPanel

public java.awt.Component createAdvancedOptionsPanel(javax.swing.JDialog parentDialog,
                                                     javax.swing.JComboBox hostnameBox,
                                                     javax.swing.JTextField passwordField)
Creates the "Advanced Options" panel.

Parameters:
parentDialog - The dialog to which the panel will be added.

createForgotPasswordButton

protected javax.swing.JButton createForgotPasswordButton()
Creates and returns a button labeled "Forgot your password?". This method should return null if there is no password retrieving functionality on the server. The default implementation returns a simple JButton with the label "Forgot your password?".

forgotPasswordActionPerformed

protected abstract void forgotPasswordActionPerformed()
This method is called when the button allowing the user to retrieve his password is pressed or an equivalent action is taken by the user.

createConnectButton

protected javax.swing.JButton createConnectButton()
Creates and returns a "Connect" button. The default implementation returns a simple JButton with the label "Connect". This method may not return null.

connectActionPerformed

protected void connectActionPerformed()
This method is called when the connect button is pressed or an equivalent action is taken by the user.

createMembersPanel

public java.awt.Component createMembersPanel(javax.swing.JDialog parentDialog,
                                             javax.swing.JTextField usernameField,
                                             javax.swing.JPasswordField passwordField,
                                             javax.swing.JCheckBox savePWCheckBox)
Creates the "Members" panel, the panel with options for members.

Parameters:
parentDialog - The dialog to which the panel will be added.

createCancelButtonPanel

public java.awt.Component createCancelButtonPanel(javax.swing.JDialog parentDialog)
Creates the panel with the "Cancel" button - the button that cancels the connection.

Parameters:
parentDialog - The dialog to which the panel will be added.

findInputIllegalityReason

public java.lang.String findInputIllegalityReason(java.lang.String username,
                                                  java.lang.String password,
                                                  java.lang.String hostname,
                                                  java.lang.String port,
                                                  boolean checkUsernameAndPassword)
Determines whether the currently specified user details are valid. If so, returns null. Otherwise returns a string specifying what's invalid about them. The checkUsernameAndPassword argument specifies whether the username and password fields should be checked. The default implementation checks that the port value is a valid port.

createConnectionImpl

protected abstract JinConnection createConnectionImpl(java.lang.String hostname,
                                                      int port,
                                                      java.lang.String username,
                                                      java.lang.String password)
This method is meant to be overriden by subclasses to actually create the connection based on the specified values.

isCanceled

public boolean isCanceled()
Returns true if the user canceled the connection, false otherwise.

Specified by:
isCanceled in interface LoginDialog

Returns the User object filled with the information supplied by the user.
